p: These drugs are nucleic acid analogs, similar to ACV with a shared mechanism of action that interferes with the function of the viral DNA polymerase ( De Clercq, 2013). These compounds differ from each other mainly in their bioavailability, half-life in the body and dosing ( Wagstaff and Bryson, 1994), yet similar to ACV they reduce herpetic lesions and associated pain in approximately 1â€“3 days, as compared to untreated groups when used topically ( Emmert, 2000).
